intro: Sisymbrium palustre, commonly known as marsh mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, meadows, and stream banks. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium palustre is characterized by its distinctive seed pods that split open to release the seeds, a feature common in the Brassicaceae family.
